snippet: The International Energy Agency's long-term forecast that the United States would exceed Saudi Arabia in production led to a clash between OPEC Secretary General Abdalla El-Badri and the executive director of the agency, Maria Van der Hoeven, at the...
abstract: The International Energy Agency's long-term forecast that the United States would exceed Saudi Arabia in production led to a clash between OPEC Secretary General Abdalla El-Badri and the executive director of the agency, Maria Van der Hoeven, at the Oil and Money Conference convened Tuesday in London by the International Herald Tribune and Energy Intelligence.

headline.main: U.S. and Iraq Called Game Changers in Oil Supply
